input_text:
Job Title: Financial Representative

Location: Grandview Heights, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, Finance, General Business

Description:
ome work for one of Columbus's Top Employers, who is known for offering career growth opportunities and a friendly work environment. Use your winning personality to make a splash in a new position!
A leading employer in the insurance and financial services industry wants you to work for them. This company is a U.S. based Fortune 100 company headquartered in Columbus, Ohio. They have a history of strength and stability dating back nearly 90 years. Their commitment is to help America successfully prepare for and live in retirement. They also pride themselves on being more than a business by engaging in the communities where they work and live. This commitment has earned them a place on Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For...eight years in a row!
We are looking to fill an immediate need for 7 Financial Representatives to work in the Life New Business Solutions Center. Our team is a nationally known leader in the field of financial services and insurance.
Why Work for Us:Your hourly pay rate will be $17.50-$19.00 per hour!The work site 1000 Yard St. Grandview Heights!Candidates need to be available to work between the hours of 11:30 am to 8:00 pm Monday thru Thursday and Friday 9:30am to 6:00 pm. No weekends. (mandatory training is for 4 weeks 9am-4:30pm M-F) Flexible work options (hybrid WFH) can be discussed after 2 months based on performance.Weekly Pay and Health BenefitsCareer growth opportunities
What you would be doing:The Life New Business Solutions Center team is responsible for taking inbound calls from agents who submit life insurance applications. This team answers inbound calls for all pending life cases for all distributions and acts as a liaison to the Case Managers and Underwriters. The position is focused on ensuring that the life insurance policies meet good order requirements and completeness and performs data entry into the administrative systems. This Solution Center is responsible for delivering a quality experience with each interaction, while maintaining and exceeding service level agreements. This role requires strong attention to detail, the ability to learn fast and to manage ambiguous requirements, and a strong quality and productivity focus. Technical knowledge relating to life insurance, soft-phone skills and multi-tasking are just a few of the critical attributes needed to be successful in this role.
What we are looking for in a candidate:Have an engaging personalityA candidate who hunts for ideas and seeks feedback for opportunities to improve in their jobEasily adapts to changePassionate and drivenBe passionate and believe in what we do and who we areSomeone interested in building a career in Financial Services
As an ideal candidate you will have:A completed or nearly completed bachelor's degree (preferably in Business, Communications, Economics or a related field)Candidates interested in building a career in a service atmosphere with a top employerOne year of solid work experience in a service related field. Restaurant, retail, administrative, hospitality, etc.Candidates must be able to deliver friendly customer service while talking on the phone and working through computer systems simultaneously
Interested?Make sure your resume is up to date and forward it to michelle.liggett@randstadusa.com for consideration. Thank you and we look forward to connecting with you!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

delivering a quality experience with each interaction

flexible work options (hybrid WFH) after 2 months

Known for helping America successfully prepare for and live in retirement. Engages in the communities where they work and live, earning a place on Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row.
